Is it easier than requesting the txHash? I understand it is potentially more flexible but in practice, seems a lot cheaper (in terms of coreDev time and potentially gas) to simply have an opcode to export all aspects of the transaction, including the txHash.

author: draganrakita
content: I just finished reading about EIP-2718, and it seems it is split between EIP-2976 (Spec for transaction type) and EIP-2972 (Legacy transaction type) does this make 2718 obsolete?

author: sky.cactus
content: 2976 depends on 2718 (it is a new transaction type).

author: draganrakita
content: yea i missed "over Gossip" part of 2976

author: sky.cactus
content: Sorry, 2972 is the new transaction type built on 2718, 2976 is for actually gossipping 2718 transactions (necessary for them to actually work).

author: sky.cactus
content: All 3 used to be in one EIP, but they were split to help with clarity.
